questions.question: 'IT "ROCKS" AS NEW HAMPSHIRE'S NICKNAME'
'UNTIL AROUND 1680, NEW HAMPSHIRE WAS OFFICIALLY A PART OF THIS COLONY'
'IN APRIL 1963 GOV. JOHN KING SIGNED THE BILL ALLOWING ONE OF THESE GAMES IN THE STATE'
'THOUGH IT RECENTLY FELL DOWN, THIS ROCK FORMATION IS ON THE BACK OF NEW HAMPSHIRE'S STATE QUARTER'
questions.answer: the Old Man in the Mountain

questions.question: 'SO FAR, THIS 14TH PRESIDENT IS OUR ONLY CHIEF EXECUTIVE TO HAIL FROM NEW HAMPSHIRE'

'OCTOBER 7, 1984:
RONALD REAGAN & HIM'

'OCTOBER 15, 1858:
THESE 2 MEN WHO WANTED TO BE U.S. SENATOR FROM ILLINOIS'

'OCTOBER 5, 1988:
DAN QUAYLE & THIS MAN'

'OCTOBER 11, 1992:
THESE 3 MEN VYING TO BE COMMANDER IN CHIEF'
questions.answer: Perot, Clinton, and George Herbert Walker Bush

questions.question:
'OCTOBER 11, 1984:
THESE 2 VICE PRESIDENTIAL HOPEFULS'
'BUOYANT PLANK FOR WAVE RIDING'
'AN EXTRA FEE FOR A SPECIAL SERVICE'
'AN EXCESS OR OVERABUNDANT SUPPLY'
'THE BRITS CALL A DOCTOR'S OFFICE THIS'
'CLOSE OBSERVATION OF SOMEONE BY THE POLICE'
'AT 33 HE DRAFTED THE DECLARATION OF INDEPENDENCE'
'HE WAS 33 WHEN HE FIRST EXHIBITED HIS 32 "CAMPBELL'S SOUP CANS"'
'HE WAS 33 WHEN HE NAILED HIS 95 THESES TO THE DOOR OF THE WITTENBERG CASTLE CHURCH'
'AND TO THINK HE WAS 33 WHEN HE PUBLISHED HIS FIRST BOOK, "AND TO THINK THAT I SAW IT ON MULBERRY STREET"'
'ON MAY 29, 1953 HE LITERALLY FOUND HIMSELF ON TOP OF THE WORLD, ALONG WITH HIS GUIDE'
'ACE & TRUE VALUE BOTH SERVE AS THIS TYPE OF STORE'
'THE MENTAL CAPACITY TO RECALL FACTS, OR A SHOW-STOPPING NUMBER FROM "CATS"'
'CASEMENT, BOW & DOUBLE-HUNG ARE THESE'
'ONE-WORD NAME FOR THE LIZARD SEEN HERE--REMEMBER THE CATEGORY!'
'A SWELLING UNDER THE EYE, OR A QUIET, TIMID PERSON'
'ROY E., SON OF ONE OF THIS ENTERTAINMENT COMPANY'S FOUNDERS, IS ITS VICE CHAIRMAN'
'IN 1991, BEN BRADLEE RETIRED AS THE EDITOR OF THIS NEWSPAPER & JOINED ITS BOARD OF DIRECTORS'
'A CITY IN NORTHERN INDIANA WAS NAMED FOR THIS CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF U.S. STEEL'
'THE CHIEF JUSTICE & VICE-PRESIDENT OF THE U.S. ARE "INSTITUTIONALIZED" ON ITS BOARD OF REGENTS'
'IN 1997, THIS ACTOR JOINED THE BOARD OF THE NRA AND WAS ELECTED VICE PRESIDENT'
'"YOU GIVE LOVE A BAD NAME" WAS THIS NEW JERSEY GROUP'S FIRST NO. 1 HIT'
'(HEY, I'M MARK MCGRATH, &) ONE OF MY ALL-TIME FAVORITE BANDS IS THIS JOHNNY ROTTEN-SID VICIOUS GROUP THAT LASTED ONLY 3 YEARS IN THE 1970S'
'PAUL SIMONON IS SMASHING HIS BASS ON THE COVER OF THIS GROUP'S "LONDON CALLING"'
'FANS OFFER THANKSGIVING FOR DOLORES O'RIORDAN, LEAD SINGER OF THIS BAND WITH THE HIT "LINGER"'
'A SONG BY THE BONZO DOG BAND GAVE THIS "I WILL POSSESS YOUR HEART" GROUP ITS GRISLY NAME'
'THE "SILLY" TYPE OF THIS PRODUCT WAS INTRODUCED IN 1950; DON'T USE IT TO GLAZE WINDOWS'
'TRANSLATE THE PETER BOYLE-SUNG LYRIC HEARD HERE'
'A PLOTTED REVOLT TO OVERTHROW A GOVERNMENT, EXECUTED WITH SPEED'
'FROM THE LATIN FOR "ROTTEN", IT'S AN ADJECTIVE REFERRING TO FOUL DECAY'
'AFTER LILLIPUT, GULLIVER TRAVELS ON TO THIS FLYING ISLAND POPULATED BY ABSURD FOLK'
'HIS SONG "HELLO MUDDAH, HELLO FADDUH!" MAY HAVE BEEN BASED ON THE LETTERS HIS SON ROBERT SENT FROM CAMP CHAMPLAIN'
'"SHE IS AFRAID TO COME OUT OF THE WATER" BECAUSE IT'S WHAT "SHE WORE FOR THE FIRST TIME TODAY"'
questions.answer: an itsy bitsy teenie weenie yellow polka dot bikini

questions.question: 'THIS FUNKY GUY WAS "BORN IN ARIZONA, MOVED TO BABYLONIA" & "GOT A CONDO MADE A STONE-A"'
'THIS TITLE GUY SAID, "OOO EEE, OOO AH AH, TING TANG, WALLA WALLA BING BANG"'
'THIS 1920S NOVELTY HIT SUPPOSEDLY GOT ITS TITLE FROM THE CONFUSING STATEMENT OF A GREEK FRUIT PEDDLER'
'THE SURGEON BEGINS BY MAKING AN INCISION ABOVE THE HAIRLINE IN THIS COSMETIC PROCEDURE AKA RHYTIDOPLASTY'

'(SARAH OF THE CLUE CREW SHOWS AN ANATOMICAL DIAGRAM ON THE MONITOR.) NAMED FOR A 19TH-CENTURY SURGEON, MCBURNEY'S POINT, 2/3RDS THE DISTANCE BETWEEN THE UMBILICUS & THE ILIAC CREST OF THE PELVIS, IS THE MOST TENDER ABDOMINAL AREA WHEN THIS ORGAN IS INFLAMED & OFTEN REQUIRES SURGERY'
'HIP REPLACEMENT ENTAILS REMOVING THE ARTHRITIC HEAD OF THIS BONE & PREPARING A NEW SOCKET IN THE PELVIC BONE'
'LASER SURGERY CAN FIX THE ACUTE TYPE OF THIS EYE DISEASE IN WHICH THE IRIS OBSTRUCTS THE FLOW OF THE AQUEOUS HUMOR'
'SURGERY MAY BE NECESSARY IF THIS, AN ENLARGEMENT OF THE THYROID, CAUSES DIFFICULTY IN BREATHING & SWALLOWING'
'IN 1871 TELEGRAPH OPERATORS HONORED HIM WITH A BRONZE STATUE IN CENTRAL PARK'
'A WING AT THE MAINE MEDICAL CENTER BEARS THE NAME OF THIS FREEPORT RETAILER & OUTDOORSMAN'
'SADLY, THIS LEADER OF THE GREEN MOUNTAIN BOYS DIDN'T LIVE TO SEE VERMONT ENTER THE UNION; HE DIED 2 YEARS BEFORE'
'THIS PRESIDENT'S FATHER, PRESCOTT, REPRESENTED CONNECTICUT IN THE SENATE FROM 1952 TO 1963'
'DURING A CANOE RIDE IN 1839, HE REALIZED RATHER THAN TEACH, HE WANTED TO BE A POET OF NATURE'
'SPORTING A SQUASH-BLOSSOM HAIRDO (THINK A PRINCESS LEIA LOOK) MEANS A HOPI INDIAN WOMAN IS THIS'
'IT'S THE "TANTALIZING" SYNONYM FOR BACKCOMING HAIR TO INCREASE FULLNESS'
'WHEN SOMEONE SPEAKS ABOUT A FU MANCHU, HE'S USUALLY REFERRING TO THIS HAIRY FEATURE'
'THE HAIRS ON THIS PART OF A FLY CONTAIN A MAJORITY OF ITS "TASTE BUDS"'
'THERE'S VERY LITTLE HAIR ON AN ADULT ELEPHANT; THE LONGEST & THICKEST ARE THE EYELASHES & THOSE FOUND ON THIS'

final-jeopardy.question: 'THE FIRST MAN TO DIE AS THE RESULT OF ONE OF THESE ACCIDENTS WAS LT. THOMAS SELFRIDGE ON SEPT. 17, 1908'
